column1: #Text=Polycrystalline samples of AeCo2As2 and AeNi2As2 (Ae = Ca, Sr and Ba) were first synthesized by a conventional solid state reaction method.
#Text=At first, CoAs and NiAs were synthesized by mixing Co or Ni (purity: 99.9%) and As (purity: 99.9%) in a ratio of 1 : 1 and firing them in evacuated silica tubes at 800  ̊C for 12 hours.
#Text=Next, Ae (purity: 99%) and CoAs or NiAs were mixed in appropriate ratios and firing  in  evacuated  silica  tubes  at  1000   ̊C  for  12  hours.
#Text=This  step  was  conducted  in  the  glove  box  filled  with  highly  pure  N2  gas  to  prevent  Ae  from  oxidation.
#Text=Obtained  samples  of  AeCo2As2  and  AeNi2As2 were mixed in molar ratios of 1 - x : x and fired at 1000  ̊C for 12 hours in evacuated silica tubes.
